thread.title: In defence of Bronwyn Bishop
thread.title_full: In defence of Bronwyn Bishop | afr.com

author: Will Glasgow
title: In defence of Bronwyn Bishop
text:
Bronwyn Bishop has long enjoyed helicopters, as is her right. Andrew Campbell Share on twitter Share on Google Plus by Will Glasgow That's it. I'm done. I'm going back to New Zealand.
I do not want to live in a banana republic that gets into such a huff when the Speaker of the House flies in a helicopter , as is surely her right.
No wonder Tony Shepherd , Martin Parkinson and the gang have been in a such a state about the future of the country.
Sure, Shep's crew were mostly talking about the stalling of economic reform – but, in a broader sense, doesn't that include Bronwyn Bishop 's right to get her Vin Diesel on and fly in a chopper? Just a bit?
Illustration: Rod Clement If I was a member of the Liberal Party, I would be calling Brian Loughnane and asking him to take me off the books. Pronto.
So let's get this straight – a senior NSW Liberal brought a bit of style to a party fundraising event at a golf club in Geelong, and this is how they treat her? Honestly, the Liberal Party should cough up the $5227. It sounds like a bargain to me.
What doesn't pass the " sniff test " – to pinch a mangled, stolen Alan Jones phrase – is the treatment of the 72-year-old centre-right stalwart Bronnie by the NSW moderate leader (and Treasurer) Joe Hockey . What is wrong with that guy?
Since when does that litigious , cigar-chomping , Canberra landlord get to give lectures about what's "not a good look" for the government? Not a good look is his trademark. Leave Bronnie alone.
